text: The 1926 Argentine Primera División was the 35th season of top-flight football in Argentina. The AFA championship began on April 18 and ended on January 16, 1927. The AAm season began on April 4 and ended on November 21. All Boys, Colegiales, El Porvenir, Nueva Chicago, Sportivo Barracas and Temperley moved to rival league Asociación Amateurs when most of fixtures had been disputed.Argentina: 1ra. División Asociación Argentina 1926 at Historia y Futbol Teams promoted where Sportivo Balcarce (AFA) and Talleres de Remedios de Escalada (AAm). Boca Juniors won its 5th. league title (AFA) while Independiente obtained the AAm championship, achieving the 2nd. title for the club. At the end of the season, Alvear, Argentino de Banfield, Boca Alumni, Del Plata, General San Martín, Palermo, Progresista, Sportivo Balcarce, Sportivo Dock Sud, Sportsman and Universal were relegated when the associations merged.Argentina 1926 at RSSSF ==Final tables== ===Asociación Argentina de Football - Copa Campeonato=== ===Asociación Amateurs de Football=== ==References== Category:Argentine Primera División seasons Category:1926 in Argentine football Category:1926 in South American football
title: 1926 Argentine Primera División
